oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Andrew Jackson Courts Surplus Property, 1958
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of surplus property belonging to Andrew Jackson Courts. First opened as Federal housing for African Americans in 1938, the Andrew Jackson Courts were later purchased from the U.S. government by the Nashville Housing Authority. The homes are located on Jackson Street in North Nashvile. Photographed by the Nashville Housing Authority, 1958. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
